column4: hi :) anyone familiar with fixing I/O errors on a data-storage hdd in ubuntu 9.04 ? i ran   e2fsck -f /dev/sdb2   on it a couple times ... but it keeps happening, i'm unable to save text files reliably in gedit. is it safe to do a Complete Removal and then Reinstall gedit using synaptic package manager?  something there says it will remove ubuntu-desktop to do that!?!
The more safest thing you can do is backing up your data and change your HDD ;)
try the following command: smartctl -a /dev/sda and pastebin it ;)
and if smartctl is not found, apt-get install smartmontools
